reviewText: Was reluctant to get involved in another "police procedural", but have been a Tom Selleck fan thru the ages, and had just went thru the Jesse Stone series, so I was primed to be positive. My wife and I got hooked immediately. We love the entire cast. Tom, Donnie, Bridget, Will and Len. Not one character can bring up negative thoughts. Ending each show with a Sunday family Dinner is a stroke of genius, (the capital D is intentional), Whether one grew up that way, or just dreamed of it, it works well. I hope it continues for ten seasons. We went thru the first three seasons non-stop, and have no negative thoughts. We were a little upset with the changes in Danny's partners, though.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Watched Blue in the third season got hooked , had to order the first and second season! Well worth the money. I will also buy all seasons to follow, because it is just that good!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: This continues to be one of the best series prroduced. You will genuinely care about the characters. Well worth watching the entire season.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Tom Selleck has been a favorite for at least a couple of decades, but he doesn't save this series. Darn it. I don't feel compelled in the least to care what's going to happen next. Sad, because I had high hopes for the DVD set.
summary: It's OK, but just couldn't get into it
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I like the actors and there performing, special in this police tv movie, its ok to see at night, very good!

reviewText: This has got to be one of my favorite of all shows on TV.  I love Tom Selleck's movies..(hopefully he will do another Jesse Stone)This particular series though shown on TV - I did not watch..but after seeing the first one, I was "hooked".  It is a good police type show, but not all the "blood and guts" but a lot of family interacting.  Tom Selleck is the father and has two sons who are policemen and another that was a policeman but was killed while on duty.  His only daughter is a lawher..Great family together.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Its a story talks about the serial of crimes in USA, A family which has a challenge to investigate about criminals and to help the justice to find the string of the clue of the crime.I liked that each part of the family works with the police their main job requires them as police and lawyer to investigate about different case help each other in reaching to reasonable evidence. What I dislike that I couldn't find the special feature of film making which I really care to watch this option in every DVD player.I recommend it to those who are interested in police stories and to be above +18
summary: My best police story I have seen
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Blue Bloods is a fairly good show based on the strength of it's fine cast.  I guess I have been spoiled by cable, but the show is a tad tame and the story andrealism suffers a bit for it.  However, it is a very good, family friendly show.  I find the plots a tad simplistic and formulaic, but I don't think that is the show's strength.  The strength is the family dynamic of the whole group.  The fact that every character in the show is related to each other is the show hook, and I think it works on this level.  It is a family drama of a family in law enforcement.  Tom Selleck is as good as he ever is, and brings a great gravitas to the show.  Donnie Walberg, the oldest son, is good, but formulaic cop who bends the rules.  What sets him apart is his relationship with his family, both his siblings and his wife and kids.  Bridget Moynihan plays the daughter who is the Assistant DA.  She gets shafted the worst with a lot of interesting story lines with her ending abruptly.  She always seems to be the support.  Even the regular supporting characters are good.  Nick Turturro plays an affable, but brilliant police trainer of Nick Ellis, the brother rookie.  My favorite character is Jennifer Esposito, not just because she is absolutely beautiful, but also her great supporting role as the partner to Donniw Walberg.  In the end, not necessarily the best cop show I've seen, but in the top ten.  It is hindered probably by standards and practices by CBS.  It falls very short of being real gritty or real, but I really do like the family story and that's what makes it above average.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Great show, with interesting episodes. We really enjoy this program, realistic situations.Pleased also, with the condition of this set!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: yes, I just started watching the 3rd season and the last episode comes on at 10PM, tonight, which I hope toget to watch....I did watch it last week and think it is a continued episode.That is why I am interested in seeing episodes from Season 1 and 2....Tom Selick is great in it and so are thefamily members/actors and the story line.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: One of the best TV shows.  NYC cops, many concentrated in one family.  Diverse characters/strong personalities. Excellent writing/stories.  Cops-eye view from rookie on-the-beat to the commissioner who eschews politics despite pressures.  Strong women, side-by-side with good men in work and in family.
summary: Great acting, great stories, great feel for New York City
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I bought this for my DAD and he is enjoying the series with Tom Selleck. I think it is a very good show and so glad I bought it!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I bought this boxed set of Blue Bloods: The First Season for my son and his wife. I watched all episodes as they aired on TV and consider this series the best new series of 2010. It has elements of The Waltons set in a New York City procedural cop drama. Tom Selleck is the catalyst and Donnie Walberg is excellent. I recommend it highly.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: What can you say? I had just finished watching all the old Magnum PI's on Netflix and love the current network season, but I did not start watching Blue Bloods until this year so I had missed all the older seasons. I LOVE this show: family values, Catholicism, great acting and plots, and it isn't as dark or gory as many of the current crop of cop shows, ie, CSI etc. I really really LOVE that it ends hopefully each time.My favorite part of each show are the Family Dinners....I hope that Selleck and the show's producers are inadvertently causing a revival of the Family Dinner in America. It would be nice.
summary: C'mon Up to the (Reagan) house, and have dinner!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: This is the BEST program on TV!  I absolutely love the characters.  Tom Selleck is perfect as the Police Commissioner. I cannot imagine anyone else playing it.  Follow up with Wahlberg, who is a very strong detective in this role.  The interaction between the family members is so real.To top it all off, for the most part, it is family friendly.  We definitely need more shows like this one.I just wish there were more episodes.  Very long wait in between seasons.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I love Blue Bloods, never tire of it.  Love the family aspect of this show, the characters and true aspects of lives in public service.  Each actor builds upon the others to make this one of best shows on TV.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Blue Bloods started with a high level of expectations and it hasn't stopped.  Of course Tom Selleck as Frank Reagan, Police Commissioner is one of the most impressive characters of the show ! It is so great to see Nichholas Turturro on the tube again (NYPD Blue as Detective James Martinez) ! ! !  The Police Commissioner struggles with ethics and bad guys balanced with the police as well as the Mayor.  The first season Mayor was a flake, fortunately the second season has David Ramsey as Mayor Carter Poole - Outstanding character !  You might remember him from Dexter as Anton :)  Back to Season One.  I wasn't a real fan of Danny Reagan (Donnie Wahlberg) and maybe he still isn't  but he works the character and is sincerely believable and ultimately, that is what makes a show work for me. It can be difficult to has a family relationship woven into the fabric of a police drama but the Sunday dinners help create a strong bond with the family as well as connecting the family into the police drama plot line.  The grandfather, Henry Reagan (Len Cariou) retired Police Commissioner not only links his family into strong relationships but also contributes his expertise into the police drama.  This is one TV series that works well because of the combination of their characters.  Selleck and Walhberg can not stand alone here, however, they are well supported.  It did take me a couple of shows to become vested into the Reagan's but today, Blue Bloods is one of my solid TV shows.  Watching it  without commercials is the absolute best in TV.
summary: GREAT NY COP Show, Inclusive of Law Enforcement Family - TOP NOTCH ! ! !
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I love Tom Selleck, but sometimes it is too much.  Plus, the acting isn't as good as in his other works.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: ..or how about"Ozzie and Harriet join the New York Police Department".."Father knows best because he's the police commissioner"might also suffice to explain,in as few words as possible the whole premise of this sorry show..The notion that "this is one of the best new shows out there"as expressed by some who have offered reviews of this mess indicates the absolute lack of taste existing today amongst those who still watch the networks..These are,afterall,the same audience demographic that keeps slop like the many"reality"t.v.shows in production while sinking truly excellent shows after a season or less because the same demographic audience can't really be bothered to think while watching..If ever they redo"Leave it to Beaver"Tom Selleck will certainly be cast as Ward Cleaver,in that he is already playing that role now on"Bluebloods"..Truly a steep drop for Selleck given his outstanding turn as Jess Stone in several recent made-for-television films..The commissioner that he plays on"Blue Bloods"is so one dimensional as to be almost flat,forever spouting noble platitudes,behaving woodenly,and self-righteously..Len Cariou whose genuine acting chops were showcased in a recent arc of the cable show"Damages" is Grandpa walton,an almost cartoonish sort of charecter ,while the siblings,two cop sons and one attorney daughter are stereotypes..The plots,such as they are,have little mystery.."Danny" and his female partner are always running after some"perp"trying to escape(and thesefleeing suspects more often than not wind up running into traffic and getting run down)..indeed,the plots function only to allow the soap opera aspects of"Blue Bloods"to be carried along,having little or no value beyond this..And the sit-down meals that bring this family together are so absurdly written as to make me gag..Sure,there may be a few families who behave so on-cue somewhere in america but I have never encountered them,and I'm well over 60 years old...Such families,for the most part,exist only in the minds of hack writers and right wing"family values"politicians..Oh well..Goodnight commissioner...Goodnight Grandpa..Goodnight Danny...Goodnight John-Boy.... postscript...Having offered up a review of this BORING show (and I'm not the only one who finds it boring as indicated by other reviews here)I find that the"family values"crowd has responded in force(SEE "COMMENTS")..Apparently thier motto is"love it or else"...indeed NOT loving this bland milktoast hackwork designates me as a"lefty",and,to make it all more stereotypical of that crowd we"lefties "only like dysfunctional families"To say WRONG to this sort of thing or those who come to such lame conclusions would of course be pointless as having given an honest review of this show that did not praise it is apparently enough to work these people up to the point where they froth at the mouth..It remains a lame and dredfully boring show however I am glad that it warms the hearts of all of the "righties"out there..Apparently it is o.k.for me to say that a bottom-of-the-barrel,unimaginative heap of flapdoodle like this show is "great"but if I say otherwise it is time to start the personal name-calling..Hey,right winger family values types here a heads-up for you;IT'S ONLY A T.V.PROGRAM !...and a terrible and boring one at that !
summary: The waltons with badges and guns...
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I love this show and recommend it all the time to family/friends.  I have a passion for detective/investigative type series.  I'm detailed oriented and love trying to solve the case before the end of the show.  Tom Selleck is a favorite of mine...the Irish family/law inforcement tradition in the Reagan family engaging story line.  Each episode is always well written.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Blue Bloods was one of the best new series of the 2010-11 TV Season. I have always liked Tom Selleck and the rest of the cast is an excellent fit also.
summary: blue bloods is an excellent series
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Absolutely first rate acting, with measures of humor and fascinating, non-predictable drama. I really like the idea of a family whose members take public service seriously, remain close, meet regularly for family meals, and actually want to be with each other. Three remaining siblings of a NYC Police commissioner sometimes clash due to their very different personalities & diverse careers while genuinely caring for each other. The sibling's families have genuinely interesting dialog; and sometimes their stories reveal interesting plot lines. Tom Selleck is magnificent as one of the family's Patriarchs who is wise, believable, and an ideal if not perfect father, with years of sometimes painful loss. Filled with pathos; this series has deeply moving stories, spattered with humor...a rare combination with Police/Detective series. I'm really pleased to see it has recently completed it's third season. It seems word has gotten around about how family of police officers & a district attorney are so likeable.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I have been a fan of Tom Selleck for years because of the strong moral characters he chooses to play.  He also takes painstaking care in historical accuracy as well.  Mr Selleck, thank you for setting such a fine example to a Hollywood establishment stuck in a moral sespool.  Oh and many of the storylines Selleck picks are right from our national headlines where Selleck proposes intelligent stands to our societal ills.  Well done Mr Selleck from a longtime follower!
summary: Strong, Moral Characters Wrestling Issues Right From Today's Headlines
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: We caught an episode a little while ago, when the whole family was sick, and were intrigued enough to check out the first season. What a nice surprise!Blue Bloods is the perfect mix of procedural and family show: patriarch Frank Reagan (a superb Tom Sellect) is the NYC police commissioner and his whole family is in the law and order business. His eldest son (Danny) is a detective, his youngest (Jamie) is a rookie cop and the daughter (Erin) is an assistant district attorney. Cases and family dynamics intertwine and the result is almost always compelling and very interesting. It's just a shame that CBS is getting rid of Jennifer Esposito, as she and Danny make great partners. The latest episode had Danny teamed with a bland blonde and it just wasn't the same. Bring the Jackie character back - don't mess with a great show.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Season 1 of Blue Bloods was a real treat to watch.  It didn't have the very best writing on TV or the very best acting on TV, but both were good enough to make the story lines and the characters interesting.  Speaking only as an occassional tourist, I think the show does a great job of featuring NYC (almost an uncredited character), and for people like myself who were tired of TV devolving into softcore, blood and bones, or "reality" genres, it was a relief.  In fact, the show seems to be self-conscioulsy aimed at people like me, but I don't mind that.  I trust Selleck and Wahlberg to keep the great episodes coming.  And how great is it to see Jennifer Esposito again?!
summary: Season 1: a different show: family oriented and honest at the same time
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Love this show- of course love Tom- the way the "family" interacts with each other is just like looking at a real family with real problems.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I've watched this show since it started.  I was a fan of Magnum P.I., so I figured with Tom Selleck on the show, it should be good.  Well, I was wrong about it being good, it is great! One of my favorite shows on television. And surprisingly, Donnie Wahlberg plays a great role as a rough and tough detective.  I wasn't a fan of "New Kids on the Block" but I've become of fan of his with his acting skills. Great show for anyone who likes the cop shows like "NYPD Blue", "Law and Order:  SVU", very much like those shows with the starring cast being a family.  If you haven't seen it yet, give it a try, I don't think you'll be sorry.  Always good stories and a good feeling of family being what a traditional old fashion family does do.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Thought Selleck would be the major character, but it appears this series is for the younger set....just not what I expected.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: As an avid collector mostly of the 1950-1970 period I have made an exception and havepurchased season 1 of "Blue Bloods".This is a wonderful performance from Tom Selleck very restrained as the part requires,much of television at present I find tiresome so it is a relief when a program as this appears.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: The blogs of those who love cop shows equated this to Hill Street Blues. As far as intensity, yes. The rest of the show Bloods is in a class to itself.All the characters are real and none of it seems forced. The family dinner seems a little hard to believe as NYC is a huge place and getting back to one spot for dinner each night would be a chore. Do they all live at the house? I don't think so.The violence is just a part of the plot and not used for drama."Best trained Police Force in the world" was a line from the Pilot....ahhh. I don't think so! For those of you reading this who are police firearms instructors you know what a "New York" trigger is and why it came about. We fired more rounds in the first two weeks of FBI Agent course than the NYPD uses for the entire academy! They are a good group of cops from agents that have worked with them post-911.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: It's so sentimental in it's attempt to show what a REAL family should be like, and it works.  I even cry in many of the episodes.You could even compare it to "Law and Order;"  It depends on one's perspective.
summary: A Veritable Combination of "Father Knows Best" and "Law and Order"!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Great!!!! Probably the best quality show on tv today. The action is limited, and I don't mind that. The writting is superb, all the characters are extremely well played, and the character development is of such a nature that I haven't seen on tv in a long time. I went through pretty much all the characters in my season two review, but I can't say enough about them Every single person on that show is doing an amazing job.I would like to personally thank the writters for not giving up their integrity to a CLEAN and descent show that holds the violence and sex down to a bare minimum, totally relying on great writting and superb character development.As much as I like some of the action shows I have reviewed, this show tops them all. I truely believe all the characters and writting staff, and everyone involved ought to get emmies for this show. Without a doubt, this IS the finast show on tv today.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Blue Bloods with Tom Selleck as the anchor is a fantastic show. This show demonstrates how family values and good principles can be woven together to help each character do his or her job. I can watch these shows over and over again.

reviewText: Picture is clear on this DVD release.  Several extras are included in a good looking sturdy box that will nicely protect the DVD's.  Episode guide included on the sleeve.  Box design is fairly slim and won't take up too much space on your shelf.This is one of the best new shows out there.  The whole cast is fantastic, especially Frank (Selleck) and Danny Reagan (Donnie Wahlberg).  The episodes have been well written, the plots are excellent, great shots of New York City.This show offers a nice mix of a police drama and a family drama.  Each week the show just seems to keep getting better.Looking forward to the Season 1 release!
summary: One of the Best New Shows Out There
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: This series does a great job of painting an image of the life of one family tied to the NYPD. It is a good series in that it is realistic, or somewhat so, and is entertaining. This makes it a pleasure to watch. Come to think of it though, this is only the case because there is a number of gifted actors in the series, and without them the writing and filming would not work well at all. So, you can say that this is a show driven by the actors but not harmed by a weak script or weaker production. All in all, a welcome new series that is entertaining. Get it and watch!!!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Tom Selleck stars in "Blue Bloods", a new police procedural drama for the 2010-2011 season.  Selleck plays Frank Reagan, veteran cop risen to Commissioner of the NYPD.  He is also patriarch of a close-knit clan, including Donnie Wahlberg as son Danny, a hard-nosed detective; Bridget Moynahan as daughter Erin, an assistant district attorney and single mother; Will Estes as youngest son Jamie, a rookie cop; and Len Cariou as Frank's father Henry, himself a retired police commissioner.The storylines typically involve a compelling crime of the week that manages to involve the whole family in some way, helped along with a generous helping of intergenerational family dynamics, often featuring sibling rivalries.  The gracefully aging Selleck is spot-on as a widowed father trying to help his kids and grandkids navigate life's challenges.A parallel theme is the mystery surrounding the missing Reagan, Frank's son Joe, a cop murdered on the job.  Early in the season, the FBI reaches out to Jamie to be an undercover source against the Blue Templar, a secret police society gone bad.  This theme will gather steam, leading to a dangerous and dramatic season finale."Blue Bloods: The First Season" is highly recommended as good entertainment; this reviewer hopes for a second season.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Great gift for wife's mother who seems to like Tom Selleck. I wonder why she might like to see him on TV.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: We didn't know what to expect in this new series, but it is a wonderful show, and we try to never miss a single episode.A pleasant surprise is former heartthrob Tom Selleck, who lends real dignity to the role of Commissioner.Today's issues are deal with in an even-handed manner, and the characters voice opinions that ring true.The writing is tight and tense. The viewer cares about the outcome.Note to Hollywood: there really are families out there like the one in this series--loyal, loving, close, but not perfect.We need to see more of them portrayed.
summary: Best drama on TV right now
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I am a big fan of COP/ Crime dramas. I have always enjoyed the Law and Order series' and NYPD Blue. Even though I have always enjoyed Poice Crime dramas I have always been upset by the "graphic or cheesy" dichotomy. It seems the family oriented dramas are a bit too "PG rated" to realistically portray the criminal activities in the plot. On the other side you have the gritty shows like "The Shield" and "Sons of Anarchy" who go out of the way to earn the "TV MA" rating. This show in my opinion, shoots pretty well down the middle. It is not too "happy go lucky" to be unbelievable, but not so gritty that your family (especially if you have younger kids) cannot enjoy it with you. I wouldn't want to watch Sons of Anarchy with my mother or my daughter, but this show would not offend the sensitivities of either.In the past years most COP/Procedural dramas have narrowly focused on various aspects of the Law enforcement community. We have the CIS/NCIS shows that focus mostly on the scientific forensics, we have Law and Order, which focuses on the Legal and investigative part, and we have had NYPD Blue, which focused on the "Beat Cops", and detectives, and some of the internal Police politics. This show in my opinion does a great job of wrapping all ofthese aspects in one show, using the "Reagan Family Mechanism." To clarify this, thse show focuses on one family, the Reagan Family, who are all involved with Law Enforcement in one way. The Patriarch Frank Reagan (played by Tom Selleck) is the acting Police Commisioner, his conflicts usually have to do with poltical conflicts between his office and various othe NY gov't offices and agencies. And occassionally focuses on his struggle to seperate his job as commisioner and father <being that all his sons are NYPD officers. Frank Reagan's oldest son, Danny Reagan, plyaed by Donnie Wahlberg, is a hard nosed ("do whatever it takes to put the crooks away"), vetran detective in the NYPD. His conflicts usually surround his investigations, and various things he has to do to put the bad guys away. The fact that he takes his job so seriously sometimes causes conflict with his wife and kids. Ering Reagan, played by Bridget Moynahan, is the only daughter of Frank Reagan, and she is the Assistant District Attorney (ADA) of NYC. Her conflicts ussually involve cutting legal red tape and the like (Law and Order type stuff). In addition she is a recent divorce' and is raising here teenage daughter on her own. Jaime Reagan, played by Will Estes, is the youngest of the Reagan childern, and upon graduating from Harvard Law School, he decided to join the NYPD as a patrol officer. Being a rookie cop, when the series begins, a lot of his conflicts involve hime getting used to being a cop, and learning how to be a good one. He also struggles with living up to his potential, as a Harvard grad who is now working as a beat cop. In short this eries does a great job of presenting different views of the Law enforcement culture of New York, and even though it seems improbable that a Family would have people in such different but realted places in life, I think the mechaism works.I really enjoy the family dynamic and focus of this series. A lot of crime dramas put the procedural stuff in front of the character aspects of the series. This show does a good job of balancing both. Throughout the First Season you get to know the Reagan Family very well, it's kind of like a "reverse- Sopranos."The casting of this series was done quite well. With A list actors (Selleck) the well-known (Wahlberg, Moynaghan), and new faces (Estes), all the actors and characters interact well and give a great performance. The only week actor, in my opinion is the actress of Erin Reagan's daughter, Nicole Reagan-Bouyled (portrayed by Sami Gayle), who actually replaced the original actress of Nicole early on in season 1. Her performance seems strained, but is tolerable.This series, unlike other NYC based dramas like Seinfeld< is actually filmed in NYC. It is really cool to see the beautiful views of NYC during transitions, and in the background of scenes. This really adds to the believability and realism of the show.Overall, I really like the fact that this show is compelling, entertaining, and appropriate for most ages. Being a family man, that is the biggest seling point to me.
summary: A great COP/Family drama series that all can enjoy
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Dearly love these episodes, so interesting and don't drag on forever..I enjoy the family unity and the higher ethical aspect.Tom Selleck portrays a impressive police comissioner plays the partsuperbly.just wishing they were on every night .I have bought all the seasons that are out and am waiting on the fourth,

reviewText: The family is very close and I enjoy that. Each character is different, but still has integrity and I think moral values. I have enjoyed this series and I am watching the second series now.

reviewText: I have to agree with all of the other "positive" comments so I won't copy what they've already said.  I truly look forward to watching these shows and until I found these, I didn't even know it was a series on television.  I have my own opinions about the characters and of course I have my favorites but the acting is good - some of the best I've seen on television. reviewText: Blue Bloods might just be the finest programs on Broadcast Television. Tom Selleck, and the rest of the cast, do a first rate job. I love Tom's Dad, and I love the way they get together for dinner at the end of the episodes. Hope it stays on the air for many, many years. The pilot just set is us all up for the good episodes to come. And the few changes in cast were good.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I love the show and all the actors on it. The story is always good.and keeps you interested to the end.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Agree with all the above regarding Blue Bloods.  Really excellent.  Gave me a whole new respect for New York's finest.  A little over the top at times but really excellent.If you like this, you must see the Jesse Stone series.  Jesse is played by Selleck, and it's wonderful.One of the main reasons that these series are so good, is casting.  All the characters are excellent.  There's not a weak actor in the bunch.  And "lesser players" stand out.  Danny's wife in Blue Bloods, Suitcase in Jesse Stone, all outstanding actors.And for the most part, aside from some pretty explicit violence these series are good for the whole family.  I wouldn't let small children watch them, too violent.  But for my teenage boys, these are programs that we watch together.
summary: If you like Blue Bloods you must see Jesse Stone
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: This series was recommended to me based on what my friends know about my values.These are well written and superbly acted stories that demonstrate the values of honesty, the consequences of bad behavior, and the rewards of family and faith.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: The first season of Bluebloods hooked me with good writing and storylines.  I like the shows family centered focus and the way it takes on issues of morality and justice.  Acting is good all around from a diverse and talented cast.The quality of the DVD's is another issue.  Picture quality was poor on all the discs, all the episodes.  It was curious because the menus were crisp and clear but as soon the the episodes started, the picture quality was grainy, pixelated like streaming without enough bandwidth. (I seriously wondered if I somehow ended up with some pirated disks.)  It was very disappointing. I hope CBS puts season 2 out on Blue-ray.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Blue Bloods is such a breath of fresh air!  Something positive on television for a change - a strong and close family with honor!  It would be difficult to go wrong with Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg, but even the supporting cast is excellent.  The show deals with difficult and heavy issues from murder to terrorism to corruption, etc. but somehow you always feel uplifted at the end as the family comes together, often with the generations gathered around the dinner table.  Tom Selleck (Frank Reagan) is the NYC Police Commissioner, Donnie Wahlberg (Danny) plays his son and a detective, a daughter is an attorney in the DA's office, another son is a rookie on the force and so on.  They do their jobs with pride and professionalism and their family bond is strong.  Highly recommend this series!
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: This is one of the best new programs on the air this season ! The selection of parts for actors fits each character, and they blend personalities with the story line lending a dramatic portrayal of respect, duty, and honor to the reputation of any police department portrayed on television today.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I bought this sight unknown as I am a fan of Tom Selleck especially his Jesse Stone pictures.The first episode, I feel, was the weakest of them all.  The series has built on each episode and has just got better and better.  It's clear where the acting talent of the Wahlberg family lies, Donnie Wahlberg keeps building on his tough cop with a heart of gold part. Amy Carlson I haven't seen since Third Watch is great albeit in the background a little.  Will Estes I have to say is easy on the eye but has a strong part.  Tom Selleck as always has a strong role and plays it well.I like the family aspect of the show with the family sitting down once a week to have dinner, makes such a change from the spoilt, irritating, dysfunctional family dramas that are often seen on TV.  I'm please to see it has gone on to a second series and if it keeps on with the family oriented plot lines and the always satisfying finalisation of each episode I feel this will go on for quite a few years.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I love this show.  The ensemble cast are very cohesive together and Tom Selleck is calmly reassuring and strong in his role as the patriarch of the Reagan clan.  I truly enjoyed this and look forward to this series continuing on as its' showing a family that sits down to Sunday dinner and discusses events of the day is truly something we are missing in our lives the last 30 years.  If people sat down with their families each week, they would be able to avoid situations that would show themselves rather than tuning them out.  Great, great show.

reviewText: Without a doubt one of the best shows currently on TV right now.  Great story lines, depth with the characters and applause for making the Sunday dinners a thread with each show. reviewText: I was drawn to this series by Tom Selleck. It looked stronger than other series coming out of the starting gate, incorporating elements of Charles Bronson's Family Of Cops as well as Hill Street Blues, one of the best police series ever. The dialogue and acting will become more natural as the cast and crew gain experience. Some of the police work is absurdly miraculous. One senses that the original scripts called for a couple hours per episode, and someone gave the order to snip them down to twenty minutes, thus robbing stories of smoother development. This feeling is particularly strong in an episode that pays tribute to officers affected by the tragedies that occurred on 911.I like the inter-generational aspect that touches on issues pertaining to the changing nature of police work. If you like police drama with some "police humor," check it out!
summary: Tom Selleck plays top cop for the NYPD
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: It's a really good series.  Since the original Law & Order ended, it's probably the best drama series now on TV in the U.S.  While perhaps the scripts do stretch it a bit when they involve every adult member of the family in a crime, they are never the less intelligently written.  Each episode is fast paced, without the over reliance on car chases, as so many crime drama do.  The producers were wise to insist on filming the show entirely in New York.  The city deserves star billing.  You just can't replicate the atmosphere if you try to film an NYC-based show in Toronto or a studio back lot in Hollywood.  Best of all, is the Blue Bloods cast.  While great ensemble casts are standard fare for British television dramas, you rarely get an ensemble cast of this caliber on an American TV show.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Television series have stayed with tried and true genres for years. At one time the three main genres were doctor series, westerns and police stories. Westerns have yet to return, doctor series have begun to peter out with ER but police stories are in full swing, at least for detective series. Now the everyday policeman, the man in blue, has a turn next to the detectives in BLUE BLOODS, season one of which has just been released on DVD.The story revolves around a family that has three generations involved in the New York police department. The main focus revolves around Frank Regan (Tom Selleck) the current police commissioner. Having served under his father Hank (Lou Cariou) who held the same rank, Frank does his best to handle the pressures of the man on the street and those in political office who seem more interested in their careers than catching criminals or protecting people.The same family has spawned Danny Reagan (Donnie Wahlberg), a tough as nails detective who's willing to do anything, step over nearly any line, to make sure that people are safe and that criminals are punished. His dedication to people's safety inevitably places him before a review board defending the actions he used, mostly violent ones, to coerce criminals to give him information. Danny is the hot head, the cop who works from his gut instead of his head.This brings us to Erin Reagan-Boyle (Bridget Moynihan), the daughter who became a prosecutor and assistant district attorney. Erin believes in bringing criminals to trial, in putting them behind bars and in doing things legally so they can be held accountable for their actions. She is the brains behind the brawn, who loves her brother but can see the bigger picture.Rounding out the family is Jamie Reagan (Will Estes), the youngest brother who went to Harvard and graduated but who turned his back on a lawyers life to dress in blue and police the streets. Jamie is a new recruit and graduate of the police academy as the series opens.Each week we witness separate crimes that on occasion blend into one another, each involving different aspects of how these characters take care of the streets of New York. They try to stay apart from one another for fear of prejudicing a jury, but each one helps the other whenever possible. There is one thread among them that plays out from start to finish and that's their missing brother.It seems he was killed in the line of duty and on occasion these characters will refer back to him, but none as much as Jamie. Just out of the academy and on the streets, he is approached one night by a government agency that wants his help. A secret society of New York police called the Blue Templar is dishing out vigilante justice and they're trying to stop it. So was Jamie's deceased brother. They play a portion of a recording he made just prior to his death which leads them to believe he was killed not in the line of duty but by the Blue Templar. And now Jamie must decide whether to join their hunt for this vigilante group or take it to his family.The series is quite well made, with some stunning visuals and photography that brings the best and the worst the New York has to offer. The acting is such that you don't think while watching that these are actors, you believe them in each role they offer. Selleck is a stand out, a far cry from both his turn as Magnum P.I. where he was comedic and action oriented and from Jesse Stone in the series of movies he's starred in where he's quiet at all times. Frank Reagan is a man not to be messed with, a man who will protect his family and his city at all costs, politics be damned.The nice thing about being able to watch season one on DVD is what I've said all along. If you missed the series from the start or were watching another at that time, you now have the chance to go back and start from the beginning. And with season two about to begin, what better chance than now to pick this one up and jump on the bandwagon? It's a series that's worth adding to any collection.
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: I'm not sure who wrote Amazon's review of this show, but I don't think we've been watching the same series.  In the published review, it sounds like vanilla ice cream - nice till something tastier comes along.WRONG!!!The characters were thoughtfully cast, the episodes well-written and directed, and the plots engaging.Having been a fireman myself, and knowing plenty of policemen, I can tell you that family support is paramount in doing the job well.  This series showcases this support system against a background of first-rate crime drama.A new twist on the standard law enforcement fare that has been copied so many times in other series makes this a refreshing change of pace.
summary: A great cast + an excellent premise = an excellent series

reviewText: I have followed the concept write-ups and CBS (Network TEN here in Australia) promotion of "Blue Bloods", and it gives me great pleasure in saying that the tone of this new drama (created by Mitchell Burgess and Robin Green, executive producers of "SouthLAnd"; and executive produced by Leonard Goldberg) offers something very special to those of us who reminisce and crave a return to the days defining Robert J. Thompson's second golden age of television drama - I am thinking of Steven Bochco classics like "Hill Street Blues" and "Brooklyn South"; and the lesser known, but one which I hold fond memories of, "Our Family Honor".  I highly, highly, highly recommend it!!!!  And I look forward to the DVD!!!!

reviewText: Blue Bloods - The First Season  [496 2014-01-22]Summary:The location is contemporary New York City and the theme is a police procedural from a unique prospective. The shows focus around the Regan family: Frank (Tom Selleck) is the Police Commissioner; his oldest son Danny (Danny Wahlberg) a hotshot detective; another son Jamie is Harvard educated but by choice a rookie cop; daughter Erin is an assistant D.A. and Henry - Frank's father, a former NYC Police Commissioner.Content:The Season One package consists of 6 disks and 22 episodes originally show on CBS during the period September 2010 through May 2011. Also included are several special features on disk 6 that I founding modestly interesting but somewhat redundant.Positive Comments: Many episodes include deleted scenes, which are not to be missed. Some are quite lengthy and are interesting and informative concerning that particular episode. Season One developed a reoccurring theme of a secret society of rogue cops called the Blue Templars. Although more of a background story issue it was resolved during the climatic final season one episode. I greatly admire the Regan family. They ague, rage against one another sometimes, but all are pulling the wagon in the same direction. It was refreshing to see a show with an honest focus on genuine family values even with members who are contrary and strongly opinionated. I enjoyed the New York City local for these episodes. In fact the city is a major character in this series in my estimation.The Cast:Tom Selleck and Danny Wahlberg are terrific in their roles. Other cast members are very good - I particularly admire Danny Regan's female detective partner (Jennifer Esposito).Negative Comments: After a season long build up the climatic episode with the Blue Templars was a disappointed. Instead of a super secret group of cagey operatives they were portrayed as just a bunch of greedy thugs. Several episodes featured a politically ambitious district attorney who expressed a romantic interest in Commissioner Reagan's daughter Erin, an assistant D.A. He just disappeared from the show with no explanations. We were not told he quit or was replaced he just "vanished" without a trace although he was still Erin Regan's boss.Recommendations:This is a highly recommend show that keep my interest. If police procedurals within the context of a strong family appeals to you I believe you will enjoy viewing season 1 of Blue Bloods.
summary: A police procedurals within the context of a strong family
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Let me say off the top that we do not have TV in our home - we watch DVDs of our favorite movies and shows whenever we want and as often as we want.  Being Tom Selleck fans for nigh on 30 years through Magnum and the excellent Jesse Stone movies, we heard about his new series 'Blue Bloods' and decided to give it a try.  We have not been disappointed, in fact very surprised and satisfied with the ensemble cast - they all work!  Though we have only seen the first season I sure hope that it continues.  Each character has their part and they perform well as a family, although I think the dinner scenes are a little overblown, I'll still give it five stars.

reviewText: For some reason, I didn't watch "Blue Bloods" the first season it was on TV.  I stumbled across it in the second season and started enjoying it. Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: It may be that US cop shows reached a peak with 'The Wire' and 'The Shield'. Having been spoilt by those shows and must wait a few years for a series which matches the heights set by them. Sadly Blue Bloods does not even attempt to reach their standard and shows nothing we have not seen many times before and has been done better by the shows like 'Kojak', 'Cagney and Lacey' and 'The Streets of San Francisco.'The hook in this show is that we have a family of cops and a DA, but this is not new, remember 'A Family of Cops' with Charles Bronson and even ' Macmillan and Wife' I notice that Tom Sellick has been praised by other reviewers for his performance. That's fine if you enjoy his performance as a plank of wood, and none of the other featured performers can make up for the star's lack of emotion.We can only hope that we will not have to wait to long for a cop show which builds on the standards set by 'the Wire' and 'The Shield' just 'The Wire' built on 'Homicide Life on the Streets' and 'NYPD Blue' built 'Hill Street Blues' rather than revert like 'Blue Bloods to a sad and tired old formula.If you want to see a cop drama that pushes the boundaries I suggest the Swedish series 'Wallander' or the French series 'Spiral' both are better than any current American or British cop show.
summary: Seen it to many times before
Title: Blue Bloods: Season 1

reviewText: Love, love Tom Selleck!  This is a great family relationship and wonderful interaction.  Whole family loves it and can watch it together, rare.

reviewText: I bought this series on DVD as a gift for my cousin's daughter, Liliana.  I'm sure she will love watching it.  It's probably one of the better prime time series on TV right now. reviewText: This is a very intelligent, well-written TV series.  It is basically a police drama but examines law enforcement from all angles -- right and wrong, legality, politics, public perception, etc.  For my wife and I, this is our 2nd favorite TV series.  (Elementary is 1st.)  Blue Bloods is in the developmental stage in the first season and so it still has some rough edges.  Nevertheless, it's still a great season and a great show.
summary: One of the best shows on TV!
